Package oop.ex5.main

Class MethodCallsChecker

java.lang.Object
oop.ex5.main.MethodCallsChecker
public class MethodCallsChecker extends Object
A singleton Class which holds references to the existing methods in the program, alongside their names.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static List<String>
    calls
    A list of String, which holds all the code lines in which a method is to be called.

  • Field Details

    • calls

      public static List<String> calls
      A list of String, which holds all the code lines in which a method is to be called.

  • Method Details

    • addCall

      public static void addCall​(String call)
      This method add a call to the list of calls.
      Parameters:
      call - The call to be addded.

    • CheckCalls

      public static void CheckCalls() throws oop.ex5.main.BadArgumentsNum, VariableError, oop.ex5.main.MethodDoesNotExist
      This method checks if the calls (in the list of calls) are valid. A valid s-Java call must refer to an existing method, with an appropriate number of arguments, with a matching type.
      Throws:
      oop.ex5.main.BadArgumentsNum - In case the number of arguments given in the call don't match the actual method number of arguments.
      VariableError - In case the given arguments type don't match the actual method arguments type.
      oop.ex5.main.MethodDoesNotExist - In case of a call to a non-existing method.
